definition: clique/school/group/faction/to dispatch/to send/to assign/to appoint/pi (Greek letter Ππ)/the circular ratio pi = 3.1415926/(loanword) pie
right/correct/couple/pair/towards/at/for/to face/opposite/to treat (sb a certain way)/to match together/to adjust/to fit/to suit/to answer/to reply/classifier: couple

sentences.english: Zhao said some of her favorite events at Lew-Port were two of the parties and the school dance she attended.
sentences.chinese: 韩说她在伯特中学最喜欢的活动就是派对和舞会。

sentences.english: He's just been setting up a bachelor party, he says.
sentences.chinese: 他说他刚才在布置一个单身汉派对的会场。

sentences.english: Sally's party piece is singing whilst standing on her hands.
sentences.chinese: 萨利的派对绝活儿是倒立唱歌。

sentences.english: South SaFengMei rugh in the life to come to Mimi home swim party.
sentences.chinese: 卢伊萨奉梅南之命来咪咪家参与游泳派对。

sentences.english: Bill takes Yaoyao to Tom's birthday party.
sentences.chinese: 比尔带瑶瑶去汤姆的生日派对。

sentences.english: Includes the hit song "Banquet" by Bloc Party band.
sentences.chinese: 包括打击歌曲“夜宴”的派对带。

sentences.english: They are probably the most famous party planners in the world.
sentences.chinese: 现在他们可能是全球最出名的派对策划公司了。

sentences.english: By the way, tell your wife she throws a great party.
sentences.chinese: 还有，请告诉尊夫人她办了一个很成功的派对。

sentences.english: Why are all the best parties found on islands?
sentences.chinese: 为什么所有最好的派对会开在岛上？

sentences.english: They met at hte party and clicked right away.
sentences.chinese: 他们在派对上认识，马上就说话投机了。

sentences.english: He met her at a party.
sentences.chinese: 他在一个派对上遇见了她。

sentences.english: Norman : You don't know what day it is.
sentences.chinese: 你都不知道哪天开派对。

sentences.english: A: I'm sorry I forgot your birthday party.
sentences.chinese: 我很抱歉忘了你的生日派对。

sentences.english: To this day, countless cover versions of the song are played in clubs and at parties.
sentences.chinese: 到今天，俱乐部和派对上放过不计其数的翻唱版。

sentences.english: At a party in Paris after Violetta's return.
sentences.chinese: 薇奥蕾塔重回巴黎后的一个派对。

definition: (loanword) party (social gathering)/(Tw) party (typically associated with sex and drugs)
communal meal/formal dinner of club or group
